answers.answer: Angina is usually far more frequent. I am wondering with your description of the pain if the cause could be a pinched/trapped nerve. The areas of pain you state are very common with disc inflammation in the vertebrae just below the neck. If you run your finger down the back of your neck, it's where the first vertebrae feels like it's sticking out more, virtually level with the collar bone. MANY arm, shoulder, arm pains originate from this area because this is where the nerves run from this area. If compressed, the nerve causes pains in the areas you mention. It might be worth considering a scan, and trying prescribed anti inflammatory medication.
